headline.print_headline: A Piano Virtuoso Balanced and Buoyant

headline.main: A Piano Virtuoso Balanced and Buoyant

docs.snippet: The pianist Murray Perahia drew a large audience to Avery Fisher Hall as part of its Great Performers series....

docs.lead_paragraph: The pianist Murray Perahia drew a large audience to Avery Fisher Hall as part of its Great Performers series.

headline.print_headline: It Could Be a Garden Party, Even the Final One
headline.seo: ‘Restless Eye,’ by David Neumann, at New York Live Arts
headline.main: It Could Be a Garden Party, Even the Final One

docs.snippet: In his new work, “Restless Eye,” David Neumann presents mysteries of the human condition in funny, desperate and beautiful frailty....
docs.abstract: Claudia La Rocco reviews premiere of David Neumann dance work Restless Eye, performed by the Advanced Beginner Group at New York Live Arts.
docs.lead_paragraph: In his new work, “Restless Eye,” David Neumann presents mysteries of the human condition in funny, desperate and beautiful frailty.

headline.print_headline: German Leader Agrees to More Bailout Money for Euro Zone Nations
headline.main: German Leader Agrees to More Bailout Money for Euro Zone Nations

docs.snippet: Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany said a new 500 billion euro fund could operate in tandem with a temporary one that still has money....
docs.abstract: Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany says a new 500 billion euro fund could operate in tandem with a temporary one that still has money; statement effectively gives approval to bringing Europe's total bailout capacity to about 692 billion euros ($916 billion).

byline.original: By JAMES KANTER and MELISSA EDDY
byline.contributor: James Kanter reported from Brussels and Melissa Eddy from Berlin. Jack Ewing contributed reporting from Frankfurt.

docs.lead_paragraph: Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany said a new 500 billion euro fund could operate in tandem with a temporary one that still has money.

headline.print_headline: Frank E-Mails Reveal Negotiations at Art Gallery
headline.seo: Revealing E-Mails by Gagosian Gallery in Lichtenstein Suit
headline.main: Frank E-Mails Reveal Negotiations at Art Gallery

docs.snippet: A series of e-mails from Gagosian Gallery provide a glimpse into the sale of a Lichtenstein painting that is at the center of a dispute between the gallery and the artwork’s former owner....
docs.abstract: Series of e-mails from the Gagosian Gallery provides a rare glimpse into negotiations over a prized painting that is at the center of a dispute between the gallery and the artwork’s former owner; gallery is being sued by family of prominent art collector Jan Cowles, who claims that a 1964 Roy Lichtenstein painting was sold from her collection without consent.
docs.lead_paragraph: A series of e-mails from Gagosian Gallery provide a glimpse into the sale of a Lichtenstein painting that is at the center of a dispute between the gallery and the artwork’s former owner.

headline.print_headline: The Real Estate Mogul as an Artist
headline.seo: Janna Bullock Strikes Back at Russian Elite With Art Show
headline.main: The Real Estate Mogul as an Artist

docs.snippet: Janna Bullock, a developer and art scene fixture fighting accusations of misdeeds in Russia, has mounted an installation in New York aimed at Vladimir Putin and other prominent figures....
docs.abstract: Janna Bullock, a developer and art-scene fixture fighting accusations of misdeeds in Russia, mounts an art installation in New York aimed at Vladimir Putin and other prominent Russian figures.
docs.lead_paragraph: Janna Bullock, a developer and art scene fixture fighting accusations of misdeeds in Russia, has mounted an installation in New York aimed at Vladimir Putin and other prominent figures.

headline.print_headline: At Bottom Of Pacific, Director Sees Dark Frontier
headline.seo: Deep in Pacific, James Cameron Finds a Dark World of Tiny Creatures
headline.main: At Bottom of Pacific, Director Sees Dark Frontier

docs.snippet: James Cameron of “Avatar” fame emerged safe and sound from a perilous trip 6.8 miles down in the Pacific....
docs.abstract: Director James Cameron emerges safely from a perilous dive to the Challenger Deep area of the Marian Trench, 6.8 miles beneath the Pacific Ocean's surface; Cameron vows to make more journeys.
docs.lead_paragraph: James Cameron of “Avatar” fame emerged safe and sound from a perilous trip 6.8 miles down in the Pacific.

headline.print_headline: In Pakistan, No Quick End To Islam Conversion Case
headline.seo: No Quick Resolution to Pakistani Case of Conversion to Islam
headline.main: In Pakistan, No Quick End to Islam Conversion Case

docs.snippet: A judge ordered a Hindu woman who converted under disputed circumstances to ponder her fate for three weeks....
docs.abstract: Pakistan's Supreme Court orders Rinkel Kumari, Hindu woman who converted to Islam under disputed circumstances, to ponder her fate in protective custody, along with another Hindu woman in similar situation; ruling dashes hopes for a rapid resolution of controversy that has received intense media attention and has highlighted the sense of siege among Hindus, a prominent religious minority.
docs.lead_paragraph: A judge ordered a Hindu woman who converted under disputed circumstances to ponder her fate for three weeks.

headline.print_headline: Ballet Fans Truly Know How to Feel the Moves
headline.seo: Some Ballet Spectators Truly Know How to Feel the Moves
headline.main: Ballet Fans Truly Know How to Feel the Moves

docs.snippet: Ballet lovers may “truly feel that they are dancing” when they watch a performance, researchers have found after measuring the brain activity of experienced spectators....
docs.abstract: Study in journal PLoS One finds that ballet spectators show muscle-specific brain responses during performances that mimic those of expert dancers.
docs.lead_paragraph: Ballet lovers may “truly feel that they are dancing” when they watch a performance, researchers have found after measuring the brain activity of experienced spectators.

headline.seo: Lionel Shriver’s ‘New Republic’ Has Echoes of Sept. 11

docs.snippet: Lionel Shriver’s satirical novel revolves around a man who treats terrorism as a gentlemanly sport....
docs.abstract: Michiko Kakutani reviews book The New Republic by Lionel Shriver.
docs.lead_paragraph: Lionel Shriver’s satirical novel revolves around a man who treats terrorism as a gentlemanly sport.

headline.seo: Tips Fall Off Behind Rise in Fees and Slow Economy

docs.snippet: Workers like bellhops and hotel concierges have seen their tips decline as people travel less and try to do it less expensively....
docs.abstract: Workers like bellhops and hotel concierges have seen their tips decline as people travel less and try to do it less expensively; skycaps at airports are seeing decreased tips due to baggage fees.
docs.lead_paragraph: Workers like bellhops and hotel concierges have seen their tips decline as people travel less and try to do it less expensively.
